attributes.action: Prevent Donald Trump from entry to the British Isles
attributes.background: Donald Trump, United States Presidential candidate should be prevented access to Britain.
attributes.additional_details: The United States Presidential candidate, Donald Trump, has been expressed on numerous occasions that he would ban certain nationalities and races from access to the United States should he become President. It has been reported on numerous occasions that he has advocated physical violence towards these people and other individuals, particularly hecklers at his rallies. Such xenophobic attitudes should not be welcome visitors to Britain.

attributes.action: Get better broadband speeds in SE16.
attributes.background: I live in London (SE16) and have very low broadband speeds that aren't acceptable. At the moment I can get up to 2.6mbps (download) and 0.4mbps (upload). Living in the middle of London, you would expect to get fibre optic lines or have at least 10mbps.
attributes.additional_details: We keep being told that we will get better speeds soon. "Soon" seems to never happen as I've been hoping for better speeds since 2012.

attributes.action: Hold a second, and if necessary, third EU Referendum for a best-of-three vote.
attributes.background:
With the EU Referendum results having been announced, there is a clear divide between the country, a result bordering a tie with less than a two-percent margin. 
Those undersigned believe that a second vote should be held, to confirm the wishes of the British people, with a third vote if necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a big decision for our country. The results of the first EU referendum to decide whether or not we should remain within the European Union have already affected our nation in significant ways, most notable of which being the value of the pound, and that decision should not be left for a singular vote.

If a second vote were to happen, and the results declared the same, then no more referendums would be necessary and such a decision taken forward.

attributes.action: People over the age of 70 should not be allowed to vote
attributes.background: With the latest Brexit it is clear to see this was due to the votes of the older generation and not the younger one. However it is young people's future and they can't vote. If there is a limit on young age, why not old age?

attributes.action: Those who couldn't vote in the EU referendum (flooding and travel) to vote!
attributes.background: Many people were affected by the floods and polling stations so were unable to vote. Reopen voting to allow these people to vote.

attributes.action: Referendum for all Inner London boroughs to leave the United Kingdom
attributes.background: All Inner London Boroughs voted unanimously to remain within the European Union with over 60% voting remain. The decision by the rest of the UK to leave the EU means there should be a referendum for Inner London boroughs to leave the UK and become an independent country within the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
London provides 22% of UK GDP.
If the capital was an independent country, its £534,821 million GDP would make it the 18th largest economy in the world, just below the Netherlands. 
Outer London boroughs such as Sutton and Barking & Dagenham voted Leave therefore the independence referendum should be for Inner London boroughs.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for disabled toilets/nappy change areas to have a wall hook.
attributes.background: Disabled people and parents of children using nappy change areas carry bags too. Yet hardly any disabled toilets have pegs or hooks on the walls or doors. Why should the user have to put their belongings on a dirty toilet floor? A peg or hook on the wall or back of the door is a simple solution.
attributes.additional_details: I am the parent of an autistic child still in nappies at age 5. I have become increasingly frustrated at having to put my change bag on dirty toilet floors when a peg or hook would be so cheap to supply and install.

attributes.action: Means test Maternity Pay reflecting women on leave who are 'the breadwinner'
attributes.background:
The current basic ruling on maternity pay is as follows :

Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) is paid for up to 39 weeks. You get:
- 90% of your average weekly earnings (before tax) for the first 6 weeks
- £139.58 or 90% of your average weekly earnings (whichever is lower) for the next 33 weeks
attributes.additional_details:
Information from:
https://www.gov.uk/maternity-pay-leave/pay

attributes.action: Enforce all secondary schools to teach Drama, Art and Music at key stage three.
attributes.background:
The majority of jobs require creativity, and although you need natural talent, if these subjects are not taught, the youth will never have the freedom to think creatively and explore a world other than academia. 
Without creativity where will the next Branson, Ant & Dec, or Kelly Hoppen come from?

attributes.action: Ensure that in future, qualifying persons are automatically registered to vote.
attributes.background:
To vote in a UK election a person must be "registered to vote" and also: 18 or over, be a British citizen, a qualifying Commonwealth citizen or a citizen of the Republic of Ireland.

The requirement to register should be dropped so that those meeting criteria are automatically able to vote.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/electoral-register

attributes.action: Ban leashing dogs by their collar, in favour of front-chest harnesses
attributes.background:
Being leashed by the neck puts pressure and damage on:

- the trachea (windpipe)
- the spinal cord 
- the vertebral discs, 
- the oesophagus (gullet)

Harnesses offer better safety and comfort, alleviating pressure on the neck and also allowing the owner to better pull the dog from harms way.
attributes.additional_details: "I have observed the relationships between the neck injuries and health of dogs, and learned that if the flow of energy in the neck is interrupted or restricted, a whole array of problems may arise, including lameness, skin issues, allergies, lung and heart problems, digestive issues, ear and eye conditions and thyroid gland dysfunctions. I also suspect that the patients who have severe energy flow congestion in the neck area have higher cancer rates" - Dr. Peter Dobias, Holistic Veterinarian.

attributes.action: Impose legislation to allow online cancellation of services bought online
attributes.background: Many services such as insurance, credit record services and music streaming can be bought online, 24 hours a day. However in most cases customers are required to telephone between certain hours on certain days & speak to a salesperson who will try to convince the customer to stay.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is limiting choice & costing the public money when they are forced to continue paying for a service they no longer require because companies make the process deliberately difficult to protect their profit.

We request the government impose a legal requirement on all services that provide on-line signup to also provide an easy on-line cancellation process with the same availability without unreasonable limitations.

attributes.action: Ensure that children's safeguarding be monitored by specific named professionals
attributes.background: The Woods LSCB review states that challenge by the LSCB is vital, but the government response to the review gives responsibility to public bodies with no named professional to offer challenge or monitor change. Revised LSCB terms of reference could provide this and safeguard vulnerable children.
attributes.additional_details: The best performing LSCBs are those with strong chairs that provide robust challenge and monitor improvement. The government response to this review is to remove the statutory strength that permits this challenge. This government has a duty to ensure that its duties are wholly taken over by a named role/team within or independent of these agencies and safeguard vulnerable children, a team already existent in current LSCBs that could be strengthened by revised terms of reference.

attributes.action: Force zoos to only hold animals that are incapable of surviving in the wild.
attributes.background: Animals should not be in captivity unless they are ill or can not survive in the wild. By replacing all of the well and healthy animals with sick or maltreated ones, we can provide a better quality of life for all animals. The healthy ones by releasing them back, and the sick by saving them.

attributes.action: Ban being able to own, and have a cockerel in an urban area, they are loud.
attributes.background: I have an inconsiderate neighbour, who will not put a collar on their cockerel to reduce the noise of the crow, the cockerel cannot help it, that's the way God made it, but us humans need to keep the animals in the country and out of urban area.

attributes.action: More Gender Identity Clinics. Train up doctors and use local practices.
attributes.background: We need more Gender Identity Clinics and more trained doctors so that all Trans patients get quicker service. The longer the waiting time, the more suicides we'll see...

attributes.action: Make throwing bread and crumbs to birds a non littering offence.
attributes.background: I threw a bit of bread on the floor for the birds to eat, and I got an on the spot fine for doing this, even after I went picked it up and put it in the bin. The council workers waited in the car until after the "offence" happened, they were also only wearing all black with no high vis jackets on.

attributes.action: Create degrees and masters level apprenticeships for art and design disciplines.
attributes.background: Governments changes to creative education could contribute to the ‘collapse’ of an industry worth billions to the UK economy. Apprenticeships in Higher Education should be available as these cover creative industry skills, requirements and occupational necessities. This increases many opportunities.
attributes.additional_details: Academic research by Birmingham City University looked at changes to design practice, policy and education over the last decade and demonstrated that the subject was being increasingly marginalised. The report, titled Beyond Discipline: Design Practice and Design Education in the 21st Century, which was published by the University’s Strategic Creativity Research Lab, found that design was being devalued by Government despite the industry accounting for 3.5 per cent of the country’s GDP.

attributes.action: Abolish financial transitions by cheque between businesses
attributes.background: After having a car stolen the insurance company sent a cheque to the finance company, so instead of a transaction being made on the same day it has taken two weeks. Businesses must always make electronic transactions. In addition to this helping consumers it would also be environmentally friendly.

attributes.action: Amend unfair and harsh legislation against first time fare dodgers.
attributes.background: Many of us have done it by accident at least once in our life. However, getting caught even once now without a ticket on the London Underground can result in a criminal record and ruin the prospects an individual for life! Please help us put an end to this malicious prosecution by the TFL!
attributes.additional_details: Outdated legislation such as Regulation of Railways Act 1889 (Yes this legislation is over 100 years old.) is having a devastating impact on the futures of many people. Most individuals caught and prosecuted are teenagers with no past criminal history who then branded criminal for this minor offence! Transport for London are using this legislation to bully and scare people into settling for huge amounts of money outside of court instead of having a fair trial! Help us change this!

attributes.action: Adopt the 'Cornwall' model for all County Councils in England & Wales
attributes.background:
Cornwall, Co. Durham, Isle of Wight, Northumberland, Shropshire & Wiltshire are all Unitary Authorites with no District Councils.
The duties of former district councils is either devolved down to Town & Parish Councils, or where this is impractical (eg: roads) it is taken on at county level.
attributes.additional_details:
There are potential savings to be made in adopting the 'Cornwall' model, as there are many management positions duplicated across counties with District Councils, also some current local government buildings would be freed up for potential residential development.
Properly implememented it would also mean locally elected people would be responsible for what happens at a local level.
There are already some local authorities who are sharing services and this would be a progression of this.

attributes.action: Overseas military action to require super majority vote of two third of MP’s
attributes.background: The Petition's purpose is to ensure a higher percentage of the electorate’s views are taken account of when Parliament considers military action and that only Parliament can authorize the deployment of UK military forces as non-combative advisers in overseas conflicts to which the UK is not party.
attributes.additional_details:
A Parliamentary Motion for armed conflict is perhaps the most significant matter that our MPs’ are ever required to vote upon and as in the case of Iraq and subsequent conflicts their vote has had enormous repercussions for the United Kingdom, not only in terms of  those killed and wounded but in the aftermath, as now seen in Iraq, Afghanistan and Libya.

The present majority government received less than 37% of the vote from just 24% of the electorate at the 2015 General Election.

attributes.action: Make letter boxes for homeless people or people without an address.
attributes.background: In the UK we have a fantastic welfare system. Our country is one of the few countries in the world that provides help and benifits to those who are struggling to get by, but what about the people that have fallen off that ladder? Well to climb back up as you need an address to apply for benifits.
attributes.additional_details: That is where you come in by sighning the petition you will be helping homeless people regain there stability while they apply for benifits. Therefore helping change hundreds of thouasands of people regain a home and get off the streets for ever!

attributes.action: NOT to allow Bailiffs to enter property unless accompanied by a police officer
attributes.background: Many people today experience violent and aggressive bailiffs. To avoid assault and humiliating threats, a police officer should attend entry to any property avoiding potential physical harm to the house holder and others to remove all threats of violence or intimidation.
attributes.additional_details: That the bailiff focus on the collection procedure showing respect and non violent means using reasonable behaviour at all times.

attributes.action: Remove London's status as our capital city and move parliament out of London
attributes.background: The purpose of a capital city is to represent our country and its principles, yet London has enjoyed benefits which the rest of the UK has not had (see evidence). Creating a new capital and moving parliament away from London's influence would make it listen to the people it was made to represent.
attributes.additional_details:
Nationalised transport: http://goo.gl/RkcCRH
London's growth: http://goo.gl/dYnaey
Local museums: http://goo.gl/jUJ6ZG
Allowed corruption: http://goo.gl/7axI00

attributes.action: Select the Taxpayers Alliance to oversee Parliamentary expenses
attributes.background: As we know IPSA has not had a good record in cracking down on fraud in the Houses of Commons and Lords many time we see the political elite getting away with expenses that ordinary people have to pay for in everyday life.
attributes.additional_details: Expenses should only be for paying staff, Office equipment, and in some cases travel not for paying off mortgages on second homes, meals, etc

attributes.action: Apply the triple lock to existing old age pensions up to the new annual rate.
attributes.background: The post April 6th 2016 pensions will be increased by 2.5% (min. per year) of the full amount starting with £155-65. Pensions being paid prior to April 6th 2016 will only be increased by 2.5% based on the basic of £119-30, not on any extras earned by older pensioners by SERPS, NI contributions etc.
attributes.additional_details: The idea of the petition is to make rises fairer for older pensioners after the start of the NEW FLAT RATE OLD AGE PENSION April 6th 2016. The way the government triple lock pension increases will be applied to pensioners entitled to draw old age pension prior to April 6th 2016 could cause them to lose out very considerably, relative to the new flat rate pensioners, in some economic circumstances. Example when the CONSUMER PRICE INDEX is static or falls as in the figure used in the 2016 rise.

attributes.action: Allow shotgun certificate holders of ages 15+ to purchase their own firearms.
attributes.background: The law currently states that a shotgun certificate holder can own and possess, a shotgun and ammunition from the age of 15.
attributes.additional_details: Counter productive to this, it is required that a certifcate holder over the age of 18 to purchase the items for them, this can be a problem for potential young shooters who would like to get involved in the shooting sports but doesn't know anyone over the age of 18 who possess a valid shotgun certificate. I am proposing the lowering of the law to purchase a shotgun and ammunition to 15 which is the legal age for possession, when accompanied by their parent/guardian who signed their certificate.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to charge 3% tax on second homes   (retain for buy to let)
attributes.background: The Government introduced a 3% tax on purchases of second homes (over £40k) on 01/04/16. This was following a consultation on applying a 3% tax on buy to let properties. They did this to close a loop hole.  However, they haven't considered the consequences, or included it in any direct consultation.
attributes.additional_details:
This impacts you if you have your own home and purchase another property. This could be to help your parents, your children, your siblings, your friends. It has nothing to do with buy to let.

My sister looked after my parents as a single mum for 15 years, but they have both passed. She needs help to buy a home the Government can't provide. I will have to pay 3% tax on that home I can't afford.

Many more people will be impacted.  Please sign this petition.  It will impact you unfairly one day.

attributes.action: Legalise the sale,possession and consumption of hash heesh.
attributes.background: The consumption and classification of hash heesh seem to be less contentious than the questions over weed. Discuss any remaining obstructions to the legalisation of hash.

attributes.action: A person be given the opportunity to retire earlier on a reduced state pension.
attributes.background: The change in pension age unfairly affects people in the position of caring for somebody who because that person goes into residential care or passes away, places them with zero income after carers allowance is removed only to find it difficult to obtain employment due to their age.

attributes.action: Provide Prostheses rather than wigs for patients with total hair loss.
attributes.background: For seven years we have been asking our health provider to supply a human hair prosthesis that fits can be washed and styled.  Our GP and consultant are fully supportive but at the point of supply the bureaucrats say NO.
attributes.additional_details: Our dealings with the NHS medical professionals has been exemplary understanding  the emotional and mental strain caused by total hair loss particularly in a woman. However all requests for a proper prosthesis are denied for reasons that are unfathomable.  Example cost ( our proposal costs less ). Not NHS approved, (some trust supply). And of course the you need individual funding committee approval ( they always say NO that's their job, all requests made by doctors and consultants are ignored.

attributes.action: Use all car tax money's to repair roads and pot holes as suggested
attributes.background: I would love to drive on a smooth road with out hitting pot holes that no one seems to repair. We are forced to pay road tax and it seems the money we put in don't get used towards what it is mean for. I would also like to see cyclists pay road tax after all they use our roads
attributes.additional_details: The evidence is on every road in the UK. Holes in the roads are becoming  more and more frequent and this needs to be dealt with

attributes.action: Legalise the importation, sale and consumption of coca tea in the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Coca tea is a safe, healthy and natural herbal tea that would be beneficial to UK consumers.

The 2016 United Nations General Assembly Special Session on Drugs (UNGASS2016), to be held on the 19th-21st April, offers the unique opportunity to open up debate on the issue.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information please visit the following:

Transnational Institute - Coca leaf: Myths and Reality

http://www.druglawreform.info/en/issues/unscheduling-the-coca-leaf/item/262-coca-leaf-myths-and-reality

APPG for Drug Policy Reform - Coca leaf: A political Dilemma?

https://www.unodc.org/documents/ungass2016//Contributions/Civil/APPG_for_Drug_Policy_Reform/Coca_Report_final_25_Sept.pdf

attributes.action: Remove the 2026 deadline for claiming historic rights of way
attributes.background: In 1949 rights of way were surveyed however many routes had been left off the map due to a pro-farming consensus. Our paths have developed over centuries yet shall be lost if not claimed by 2026. Therefore I propose to remove the deadline and encourage government to take an active role in recording.
attributes.additional_details: Under the National Parks and Access to the Countryside Act 1949 rights of ways had been recorded through village council led surveys often omitting historic routes. Under Sections 53 to 56 of the CRoW Act 2000 all unrecorded pre-1949 rights of way have to be registered by 2026 or shall be lost.

attributes.action: Prevent a policy allowing "reasonable force" to maintain behaviour in schools.
attributes.background: The Department for Education published a policy paper on 17th March, called Educational Excellence Everywhere, this includes a section allowing teachers in academies to use "reasonable force to maintain behaviour". This would be a breach of the human rights of children and young people in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/educational-excellence-everywhere

attributes.action: Maintain the current policy that the Royal Air Force has on tattoos.
attributes.background: A petition has been raised to have the current policy looked at, with a view to allowing tattoos that are visible in No1 uniform. Many people strongly disagree with this, but haven't had the chance to show the government their response to the original petition. This will provide that opportunity.
attributes.additional_details: If only one side of the opinion is presented to the government, this will be biased. By having both petitions, it will provide a more realistic reflection of peoples' feelings on this matter.

attributes.action: restore the definition of fuel poverty to spending 10% of income
attributes.background: When parliament voted to end fuel poverty by 2016 the definition of fuel poverty was needing to spend more than 10% of your income. Since then the definition has been changed; this omits people at risk  being included in the figures & makes it unclear whether the target agreed in 2000 is being met.
attributes.additional_details: Prof David Gordon of the university of Bristol states that estimates suggest that 20% of the population are now fuel poor and that by the original definition of needing to spend more than 10% of income the numbers of fuel poor have been steadily rising.Rather than being eradicated by 2016 it appears that fuel poverty as debated and voted in parliament has doubled. BBC broadcast their research on "Panorama; too poor to be warm" on 21st March 2016.

attributes.action: Make the AA49 (wolverhampton) 70mph again.
attributes.background: The A449 has scrapped the national speed limit and has been replaced by a 50/60 mph speed limits. I see this as a pure waste of money and a great way to sting motorists with speed fines. I believe that it should be made a 70mph again.

attributes.action: Reduce number of Constituencies by 20% to achieve savings in Goverment spending.
attributes.background: The chancellor has confirmed that additional cuts are required in his recent Budget. As this must be shared equally, parliament itself must cut costs. Elected MPs should represent larger numbers and areas and be excluded from  having additional employments which may affect their elected obligations.

attributes.action: DVLA to review their policies of exemption circumstances for medical conditions
attributes.background: DVLA legislations states that people who are monocular are exempt from exceptional circumstances in their medical section.
attributes.additional_details: I was born with one eye and head neck and facial disfigurement I had driven for 30 years I was legal to drive until DVLA changed their policies in 2013. The condition is congenital and is a non degenerative condition. Therefore the only change is DVLA policies. The machine (esterman vision test) that DVLA use to assess people's vision for driving was not designed to assess people's ability to drive it was to detect glaucoma. Due to my disfigurement the machine isn't fit for purpose.

attributes.action: National Travel Ban on Foreign Anti-gay Officials
attributes.background: Senator Jeane Shaheen recently introduced legislation that would deny entry into the United States to non-citizens who are involved in the persecution of LGBTI people around the world. I believe this is a fantastic idea and believe the UK should have this in place also.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.gaystarnews.com/article/us-democrats-propose-national-travel-ban-on-foreign-anti-gay-officials/#gs.GCsU1ko

attributes.action: Make Parking free for doctors in NHS.
attributes.background: At present every doctor has to pay £1.50 per day parking minimum to park their vehicle to come to work. Monthly £45/- to park in place of work in hospital which should be free.
attributes.additional_details: The argument by government is that more people should travel by public transport but the argument against it is that the doctors have to work odd hours of day and night so they need to travel by personal transport if they have one which is not only more convenient then public transport at odd hours especially but also saves time if public transport is not available near to their destinations also the travel by public transport increases the expense exponentially.

attributes.action: Want equal shares in profits in houses if a couple divorce with children
attributes.background: I recently went through a divorce and when when me and my ex wife separated it was me who left the house as my children x2 needed a home, so therefore it was better for me to leave. Once we got to court the judge awarded a 70/30 split in the house profits in favour of my ex wife. It seems unfair.
attributes.additional_details: I really think this law needs changing as my question is - What is that other 20% actually gaining for my children? Who is the main benefactor in this? Is it the children, or is it the adults? On a house with profit with or without kids should be 50/50 split. That way then both adults can create homes, instead of the man struggling.

attributes.action: Regulate imports of clothing from unethical sources.
attributes.background: Thousands of workers in countries such as India are being exploited and being payed close to nothing for their hard work. Their work places are unsafe as shown by the Rana Plaza collapse. We want our government to help stop this and make sure garments coming in to our country are properly sourced.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013_Savar_building_collapse

attributes.action: Abolish PMQs and replace with legal requirement to attend select committees.
attributes.background: PMQs no longer serve any useful constitutional purpose. The weekly event has desended into nothing more than political pantomime. Instead to enforce proper democratic accountability the PM should be obliged to attend the Home, foreign and treasury select committee for an hour each per month.

attributes.action: Stop paying non uk citizens any benifits
attributes.background: If we stop paying benifits. Some migrants will leave of there own accord. Some might stop trying to come to the UK

attributes.action: Up the fine for driving using a mobile to six points off license and £500.
attributes.background: Everyday I see dozens of drivers flouting this law and families are wrecked as a result. The present penalties are woefully inadequate and provide very little deterrent.

attributes.action: Scrap the 7 day week NHS proposals or fund them by the amount the BMA requires.
attributes.background: The "7 day week" proposals would stretch the already stretched resources and people of the NHS well past breaking point, and do Not provide the funding and staff required. The petition to have Mr Hunt removed was brushed aside, can we at least agree his policies need removing?
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is in the proposals themselves and the medical practitioner's need to strike over such an unreasonable contract. No further evidence of inadequate provision is required, the burden of proof lies with those trying to push through the contract.
The BMA are the organisation representing the NHS and it's staff.

attributes.action: Make premium rate text services need physical signature on terms and charges.
attributes.background: Premium rate text services send you a text message on your mobile and when you reply/text stop, you get charged without knowing charges or terms and conditions of service. Mobile operators charge on their behalf and you can't contact these premium rate text providers.
attributes.additional_details: It's happening all too often and to vulnerable people. Make it must for premium rate text services providers to get physical signature of billpayers on charges , terms and conditions for these services.
